org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution

Class FTriangleFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.image.processing.convolution.FTriangleFilter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageProcessor<FImage>, Processor<FImage>

    public class FTriangleFilter
extends Object
implements ImageProcessor<FImage>
    Image convolution with a triangular filter. Implementation is based on repeated convolution with rectangular kernels, which is done efficiently using a integral image style approach. Overall complexity is independent of filter size and linear in the number of pixels.
    Author:
    Jonathon Hare (jsh2@ecs.soton.ac.uk)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FTriangleFilter

        public FTriangleFilter(int filterWidth,
                       int filterHeight,
                       boolean zeropad)
        Construct with the given dimensions.
        Parameters:
        filterWidth - width of filter
        filterHeight - height of filter
        zeropad - zero-pad off the edge of the image if true; duplicate edge value otherwise.

      • FTriangleFilter

        public FTriangleFilter(int filterWidth,
                       int filterHeight)
        Construct with the given dimensions. Edge effects are handled by duplicating the edge pixels.
        Parameters:
        filterWidth - half-width of filter
        filterHeight - half-height of filter

    • Method Detail

      • processImage

        public void processImage(FImage image)
        Description copied from interface: ImageProcessor
        Process an image. Implementing classes must alter the image passed in-place or assign the output to the input using Image.internalAssign(Image).
        Specified by:
        processImage in interface ImageProcessor<FImage>
        Parameters:
        image - The image to process in place.

      • createKernel1D

        public static float[] createKernel1D(int width)
        Construct a triangular kernel of the given size. The kernel will have 2*width - 1 elements.
        Parameters:
        width - the kernel half-width
        Returns:
        the triangular kernel
